page.title: 01NORTH BRENT - GENERAL
page.content: NORTH BRENT - GENERAL IMPRESSIONThis area is a largely residential London suburb. It was developed between the First World War 1914 - 1918 and the Second World War 1939 - 1945, after the Wembley Exhibition of 1926. The houses are mainly of mock Tudor design typical of the period, built mainly by developers Comben and Wakeling. It is well served by public transport and contains two major open spaces, parts of which are threatened with development which is vigorously opposed by residents. There are two parks and very good sports facilitie4s. There is one small industrial estate. The people are mainly owner occupier middle class of many nationalities, the largest group being indigenous, followed by the Asian group. Motor traffic occasionally causes problems.
